| [[Live at the Fillmore (Testament album)|Live at the Fillmore]] (1995)
}} {{Album reviews |rev1 = Allmusic |rev1score = [ Review] }} __NOTOC__ 'Low' is
the sixth studio album by American heavy metal band Testament. Released October
4th, 1994 this would be Testament's last album with Atlantic Records, leading
band members to create their own label Burnt Offerings Inc. as part of the
change.  "Low" was recorded with original band members Chuck Billy
(vocals), Eric Peterson (guitar) and Greg Christian (bass) and saw the first of
two Testament album appearances by artist John Tempesta (drums) 
 and three for artist James Murphy (guitar).  Long time
Testament collaborator Del James is also given composer and vocal credits on the
album. A music video was made for the title track. [http://www.metal-
archives.com/albums/Testament/Low/250] As of 2002, Low sold over 112,000
copies in the U.S. [http://www.blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&news-
itemID=1871]
categories: Albums with cover art by Dave McKean
